entry.title: Biggest Movers: LTC Breaks Out of Key Resistance Level After Gaining 6%
entry.summary:
Litecoin rose by as much as 6% in today‚Äôs session, as the token climbed past a key resistance level on Thursday. The move came following several attempts over several weeks, with bulls finally breaking through. Polygon was also higher, ending a recent losing streak.
Litecoin (LTC)
Litecoin (LTC) was one of Thursday‚Äôs notable gainers, as prices moved past a key resistance level.
Following a low of $88.35 on Thursday, LTC/USD rose to an intraday peak at $94.21 earlier in the day.
As a result of today‚Äôs rally, litecoin broke out of its recent ceiling at $93.00, hitting a two-week high in the process.
From the chart, it appears that Thursday‚Äôs surge came as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) broke out of a ceiling at 58.00.
Since the breakout, the index has continued to climb, and as of writing this is currently tracking at 59.76.
In the event momentum continues in this direction, there is a strong chance that LTC will move above $95.00.
Polygon (MATIC)
Polygon (MATIC) snapped a three-day losing streak on Thursday, following a crossover of moving averages (MA).
The 10-day (red) MA crossed its 25-day (blue) counterpart in today‚Äôs session, sending the price to a peak of $0.8974.
This comes following Wednesday‚Äôs low at $0.8787, which saw MATIC hit its weakest point since May 25.
Overall, market volatility in polygon remains significantly high, with earlier gains almost fading.
As of writing, MATIC is trading at $0.8934, with the RSI at a reading of 46.03, which is close to a ceiling of 48.00.
Should this aforementioned point of resistance be broken, bulls could force a move toward $0.9000.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect polygon to move above $0.9000 this week? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: TON Foundation proposes burning 50% of validator rewards
Bullish Signal? Ethereum Average Fees Declines 69% Since Early May
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Ethereum average transaction fees have dropped by almost 70% since early May. Here‚Äôs what it may mean for the asset.
Ethereum Average Transaction Fees Has Sharply Declined Recently
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Santiment, the average fee on the network was around $14 not too long ago. The ‚Äúaverage transaction fees‚Äù here naturally refers to the total amount of fees (in USD) that the average user is attaching with their transfers right now.
This indicator‚Äôs value is dependent on the amount of traffic that the Ethereum network is receiving currently. Whenever the traffic on the blockchain is low, the users have no need to attach exorbitant amounts of fees as the network usually has enough capacity to handle the transactions quickly anyway.
‚Ä¶

entry.title: Should A Bitcoin Wallet Have Rights?
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Artem Afian, a lawyer and ‚Äúlegal futurist‚Äù at Hiveon, a crypto mining ecosystem that offers services for Bitcoin mining hardware. I want to draw your attention to the fact that Bitcoin transactions ultimately occur between wallets. There are humans behind wallets, but this connection is not really what‚Äôs important. The pseudonymity of Bitcoin is thanks to the fact that there is no direct connection between the wallet and the person who owns it. It is what distinguishes a Bitcoin wallet from any other financial instrument. No matter how much regulators try to change this, the core of the technology remains the same. What does this mean? It means that, soon, wallets will be recognized as entities deserving of legal rights. First, humanity began to recognize a‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tether Surpasses Previous Market Cap Record, Reaching $83.23 Billion
entry.summary:
On June 1, 2023, the stablecoin issuer Tether exceeded the dollar-linked token USDT‚Äôs previous all-time market capitalization record of $83.2 billion, which was set in May 2022. In the last 186 days, USDT‚Äôs market value has surged by 27.15% from the low of $65.43 billion reached at the end of November 2022.
Tether Market Cap Skyrockets to $83.23 Billion, Breaking Previous May 2022 Record
With a market cap of $83.23 billion, tether (USDT) has now surpassed the stablecoin‚Äôs prior highest market capitalization. The previous peak in market cap happened just before Terra‚Äôs formerly stable coin UST lost its peg on May 9, 2023. On that day, USDT‚Äôs market cap stood at $83.2 billion, but by June 1, 2022, it had decreased to $72 billion. Following FTX‚Äôs collapse, USDT‚Äôs market valuation had dipp‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hong Kong‚Äôs New Crypto Regime Kicks In
entry.summary: Hong Kong rolled out new rules on Thursday to guide the cryptocurrency industry in the Chinese special administrative region. Crypto exchanges operating in the jurisdiction are now required to get licensed to offer their services to retail traders. Hong Kong Legalizes Crypto Trading Agency France Presse reported that the new rules include provision to protect investors by taskingexchanges to asset their clients‚Äô level of knowledge aboutcryptocurrencies before onboarding. Exchanges are also to limit investors‚Äô risk exposure with tradablecryptocurrencies confined tothose with large market capitalizations such as Bitcoin. On the other hand, the regulation rules out stablecoins, crypto derivatives and staking products. This means that exchanges in the jurisdiction will only‚Ä¶

entry.title: Strike Back: Binance Denies 20% Staff Cut Allegations, Calls It ‚ÄòFUD‚Äô
entry.summary:
As rumors swirl and speculation mounts, Binance, one of the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchanges, has forcefully denied allegations of a 20% staff cut. The exchange‚Äôs CEO, Changpeng Zhao, took to Twitter to address the issue, dismissing it as ‚ÄòFUD‚Äô (Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt).
While Zhao denied the allegations, he went ahead to express the industry‚Äôs ever-changing dynamics and the need to stay agile. Particularly, Binance emphasizes its commitment to talent optimization and cost efficiency.
Staff Cut Allegations Denied
On Wednesday, Chinese reporter Colin Wu, known for his blockchain-focused Twitter account WuBlockchain, shared a report suggesting that Binance had initiated a significant round of layoffs, amounting to approximately 20% of its workforce.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Drops Below $27,000 Ahead of US Non-Farm Payrolls
entry.summary:
Bitcoin continued to erase last week‚Äôs gains on Thursday, as prices dropped for a fourth straight session. The latest decline comes ahead of tomorrow‚Äôs non-farm payrolls (NFP) report from the United States. Despite today‚Äôs weakness, ethereum remained above $1,800.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) moved below the $27,000 level in today‚Äôs session, ahead of Friday‚Äôs non-farm payrolls report.
It is expected that the number of jobs added to the U.S. economy will come in at 190,000, less than the 253,000 sum the month prior.
BTC/USD fell to a low of $26,671.72 earlier in the day, which comes following a peak at $27,346.11 the day before.
Looking at the chart, this latest decline occurred as a result of the relative strength index (RSI) falling below a floor of 46.00.
At the time of writing this, the index is now tracking at 44.58, with a support point of 43.00 as a possible target.
Should this level be hit, there is a strong possibility that BTC will hit a floor of its own around $26,300.
Ethereum
Ethereum (ETH) was marginally lower today, however, it managed to remain above the $1,800 level.
Following a high of $1,887.71 on Thursday, ETH/USD declined to an intraday bottom at $1,846.23 earlier in the day.
The move saw ethereum edge towards a key price floor at $1,830, however, bulls have so far resisted this collision.
Similar to BTC, ETH has now fallen for a fourth straight day, with the catalyst being a failed break out of a ceiling at $1,930.
In addition to this, the RSI is now at a reading of 51.54, after failing to move past its own resistance at 59.00.
Overall, ETH has now rebounded from its previous low, and is now trading at $1,862.93.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
What peak do you expect ethereum to reach in June? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: The Crypto-Mania in American Politics Reached a Peak. That's Not Enough
entry.summary:
The topic of regulating and overseeing cryptocurrency has gained momentum in American politics for multiple reasons. There is a rising apprehension about the use of cryptocurrency for unlawful activities, such as money laundering, terrorism financing, and tax evasion. Consequently, there is a demand for stricter regulations and supervision to prevent such activities.
There is also an increasing curiosity about the potential advantages of cryptocurrency, such as enhanced financial inclusion and better cross-border payments. This has given rise to pro-crypto politicians who endorse the growth and acceptance of cryptocurrency in the United States. Increase in Crypto Lobbying Firstly, in recent years, there has been a notable surge in the use of cryptocurrencies and blockcha‚Ä¶

entry.title: Russians Warned Against Saving in Crypto Amid Declining Savings in Foreign Fiat
entry.summary:
A government official in Moscow has advised Russians to avoid cryptocurrencies now when interest in foreign fiat currencies is declining in the country. The high-risk assets are not suitable for the savings of most people and make sense only for investments by rich people, his comments suggest.
Finance Ministry Don‚Äôt Want to See Russians Saving in Cryptocurrency
Restrictions imposed by the Russian state on foreign currency accounts and operations amid Western sanctions have led to a decrease in the volume of savings kept in foreign fiats. Against this backdrop, Russians have been warned they shouldn‚Äôt switch to cryptocurrencies.
‚ÄúWe would definitely not want citizens‚Äô savings to be directed to digital currencies,‚Äù the head of the Financial Policy Department of the Russian Ministry o‚Ä¶

entry.title: Give Wings to Dreams: CoinEx Charity Launches Grant for Fulfilling Dreams
entry.summary:
PRESS RELEASE. According to a report by the World Bank in March 2023, the global poverty rate has reached an alarming figure, with approximately 659 million individuals living in impoverished conditions. Disturbingly, extreme poverty is notably concentrated in Africa. The first quarter of 2023 witnessed a surge in the number of impoverished households across Asia and Africa, primarily due to the devastating impact of natural disasters such as earthquakes and floods.
In light of these challenges, CoinEx Charity, a charity branch of CoinEx, a global crypto exchange, has taken a proactive step towards empowering the dreams of children in need. The organization has announced the launch of the ‚ÄúGrant for Fulfilling Dreams‚Äù initiative in various regions, including Vietnam, Nigeria, Thailand, I‚Ä¶

entry.title: Funding Web3 Film Calladita With Traditional Systems 'Wasn't Working', Says Director Miguel Faus
entry.summary: Spanish Film Director Miguel Faus talks with Decrypt about how he financed his movie ‚ÄúCalladita‚Äù with NFTs. In his view, Web3 and blockchain allow creators to get around some of the key difficulties present in the traditional movie industry, specifically finding funding.

entry.title: 'Web3 Offers Something Hollywood Does Not': Film3 Pioneer, Filmmaker Jordan Bayne
entry.summary: Film3 pioneer, Metacannes and The Squad founder, Jordan Bayne discusses the advantages that crypto offers to filmmakers, notably owning their work's IP throughout the entire creation, production, and distribution processes.

entry.title: Film3 Offers 'a Whole Bunch of Independent Filmmakers' Hope, Says First Flights Co-founder Nick Sadler
entry.summary: First Flights co-founder Nick Sadler sat down with Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival to discuss how Web3 can support independent filmmakers by leveraging its unique blockchain-powered crowdfunding platform.

entry.title: The Film3 Movement 'Doesn't Need Competitors, it Needs Collaborators': Bingeable CEO, Founder Stephen Murray
entry.summary: Founder and CEO of Bingeable Stephen Murray unpacks how creators and filmmakers can lower the barriers for audiences to connect with their work. "Within two clicks on hearing about the movie, you're watching it," he told Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Defining The Web3 Stack
entry.summary: In this video, part of Infura‚Äôs Web3 Dev Series, you‚Äôll learn how to define the web3 stack in order to build full stack decentralized applications. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: 'Web3 Creates a Tighter Bond' Between Audiences, Creators: MyCo CCO
entry.summary: MyCo‚Äôs streaming platform CCO Phil McKenzie talks with Decrypt about the Film3 movement and the Metacannes festival he helped to organize occurring alongside the Festival de Cannes. He explains how Web3 can help creators to find funding and create new ways to interact with the audience.

entry.title: Immutable's Chris Clay: Crypto Can Solve the 'Dreaded Rollback' in MMORPGs
entry.summary: Immutable VP and Gods Unchained Game Director Chris Clay tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how Immutable is actually immutable‚Äîand how that changes everything for both developers and players.

entry.title: Gary Vee Discusses the Rise and Impact of AI
entry.summary: During VeeCon 2023, entrepreneur spoke with Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about the rise of AI tools, what excites him about the technology, and what kind of impact he thinks it will have on creators and business.
